title: Varuni
extract:
Varuni also known as Varunani is a Hindu goddess and the female consort of Varuna (the Hindu god of water)

Legend

According to the legend, the goddess Varuni was adopted/married by Varuna when she came out of the ocean, during the churning for amrita (immortal nectar). She represents the purifying nectar of immortality (amrita). She is also "the agent of transcendent wisdom" in Hindu mythology. In Hindu art, she is often depicted with her consort Varuna.

In popular culture

  • Varuni makes an appearance in Digital Devil Saga 2 as the avatar form of Sera.

References

  • Encyclopedia for Epics of Ancient India, accessed 13 May 2006
